Node.definition: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= a document with information that is to be remembered
literally: words of days; hence: = a written record of events
= action by which humans speak written words aloud
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)
= man; ► eunuch (סָרִיס) servant of Persian (פָּרַס) king Ahasuerus (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) (Xerxes)
= man; ► eunuch (סָרִיס) servant of Ahasuerus (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= a male who has been castrated and made to serve in the women's quarters in the royal palace
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= strip of wood or stone at the bottom of a doorway; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire doorway
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which animals, humans, or deities do whatever is necessary to perform a particular event

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action

Node.gloss: to lay (one's) hands (on someone or something)
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man, probably to be identified with Xerxes; ◄ son of Darius (דָּרְיָוֶשׁ) I; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) husband of Vashti (וַשְׁתִּי) and Esther (אֶסְתֵּר)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom

= man; ◄ son of Jair (יָאִיר) cousin of Esther (אֶסְתֵּר); tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► adopted Esther (אֶסְתֵּר) after the death of her parents and later succeeded Haman (הָמָן) as vizier under Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ)

= relational referring to the part of an object that is located relatively far from the center or inside of that object; often used in opposition to the center part

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by a queen as a symbol of authority and status

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= generic designation for any article of clothing

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

Node.definition: literally: in (one's) hand; hence: = state of carrying an object physically in one's hand or as part of one's luggage
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= people belonging to the nobility ≈ and considered worthy of respect

= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a male who has been castrated and made to serve in the women's quarters in the royal palace
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: to touch; hence: = process or action by which humans or substances arrive at a certain location

Node.gloss: to be quick|to be hasty|to be rash|sudden
Node.definition: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man; ◄ son of Hammedatha (הַמְּדָתָא) descendant of Agag (אֲגַג) ► he tried to exterminate all Jews in the kingdom of Persia (פָּרַס)
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

= woman whose Hebrew name was Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה) ◄ cousin of Mordecai (מָרְדֳּכַי) ► married Xerxes (אֲחַשְׁוֵרֹושׁ) and so became queen Esther of Persia (פָּרַס) and helped save the Jews from extermination
